title: Frustrated
post:
I’ve been feeling kind of frustrated with my job search journey. I’ve been applying actively for the past 2-3 months with no luck. I’m willing to take a pay-cut but it seems like everywhere I apply, they want 2-3 years of experience at a CRO/pharma even with entry level. 

I’ve never been good at networking but I’m trying to change that. I’m doing everything I can to put myself out there on LinkedIn including making posts and commenting. I connect with recruiters. I send cold emails to companies. I reach out to the employees within the companies to discuss their experiences within the company. I apply on LinkedIn and on the companies website. I’ve had my resume looked at professionally. 

I have 8+ years of experience in healthcare as a nursing and certified nursing assistant. I am currently a nurse practitioner and have been doing clinical research as a sub-investigator since I graduated with my NP a year ago. I work alongside the CRC and understand the whole clinical trial process from the site end. 

Also, I live in an area that doesn’t have much on site pharma or CRO companies nearby. Therefore, I’m having to look for remote positions which are far and few to come by. I am open to travel but that doesn’t seems to make a difference because I’m no where near getting a CRA position. 

I know it takes time but with very little responses from recruiters and very very small responses to my hundreds of job applications, I’m feeling extremely discouraged. This is mostly a rant but also a cry for help.
disclosure: I’ve been feeling kind of frustrated

parent_comment:
Why do you want to become a CRA with pay cut after being a NP? 

I wouldn’t recommend becoming a site staff (eg CRC, research nurse, etc) if your ultimate goal is to work in pharma/CRO. I would keep applying through Q1 2023. Hiring has been slowed down quite a bit in Q4 2022. So it could be the timing as well.
comment: I ultimately want to move towards project management positions and I am seeing that CRA seems to be the best way to to open up opportunities for yourself within the industry. I am open to drug safety, pharmacovigilance and other positions as well, but again all of those require experience within pharma.
disclosure: I ultimately want to move towards project management positions and I am seeing that CRA seems to be the best way to to open up opportunities for yourself within the industry

comment: Not my first response to this post, so sorry! But I don’t think you have to take a paycut to get to PM. I’m a CRC-RN that does N O T want to go the CRA route, and from my research on this sub, it seems the CRA path is not something that is set in stone to get into PM. I’d read around this sub a bit more, but I’d 100% think you’d be selling yourself and your degree/education/experience short if you took a step back into  CRC position, and you don’t need CRA experience to get where you want.
disclosure: I’m a CRC-RN that does N O T want to go the CRA route

comment: With NP, look for clinical scientist type roles. You don't want to downgrade your knowledge to become CRA, as a clinical scientist you work with study physician and perform medical monitoring, evaluating medical data etc. You will write protocols or amendments, answer regulatory questio , site questions etc. For this job you need to have clinical knowledge and clinical experience. It took me about 1 year to get this job, and I was a study coordinator and later team lead at the site level. But you will need to work on some skills, like protocol writing etc. Try to find PIs who are doing pi initiated studies. I volunteered a lot to get experience and publications
disclosure: I was a study coordinator and later team lead

comment:
If you’re already an APN, you will take a MAJOR paycut going to a CRC position if you’re at an academic institution…… I’m a CRC-RN and I make $90k with 3.5 years ED RN experience + 2.5 years non-nurse CRC experience prior to getting my BSN. 

If your only research experience in 1 year as a sub-I….. you have a LOT to learn. As a fellow nurse, I understand wanting to get away from bedside….. I left during the height of the pandemic, I can only imagine how infinitely shittier it’s gotten. Get another year with sub-i experience. Get your CCRP. Our clinical experience, unfortunately, doesn’t mean shit when it comes to research. It’s a whole different ballgame, and you’ve just stepped into the field.

title: brain pressure from it?
post:
Hi guys 

I've been on Wellbutrin on and off for the last year or so. Been on 150xl then 300xl then back to 150xl, 100sr 2x per day and back to the same 300xl that i'm holding since a month now.

Its my first time tolerating 300xl and the good effects are being felt. Still a anxious wreck tho.

I don't know if its part of the anxiety but I really somehow feel like there a pressure on the back of my head. I don't think its a tight muscle thing, it really feel like if my brain is "overheating" or "making new connection"

I can't say it makes me feel bad, just weird? I looked around and it seems like i'm the only one in the world feeling it. Not really alot of side effect now a month after jumping on 300xl again, but this... and physical anxiety sometimes.

The pressure is felt from "inside  the skull, it probably does make sense at all, but thats the best way the describe it. Kinda like brain zap from ssri, but in a enjoyable more constant feeling.

Anyone else?
disclosure: I've been on Wellbutrin on and off

title: Can what I say in therapy be used against me?
post: I want to start therapy again and talk about some childhood trauma but I'm worried that if I reveal that that the VA could claim my depression isn't from the military and reduce my rating. Is this possible or am I being paranoid? Also, do the doctors at the VA get to see all of my disabilities and issues? Like can they read my therapy notes if they want to?
comment: I work in medical records at my VA, and I'm not a doctor. I have read a TON of vets therapy notes and have access to everything the doctors, nurse, CNAs etc can see. So yes, if the doctor wants they can read and see anything and everything from your VA visits, as well as outside medical records. I don't know your childhood trauma, what your rating is, or even what you went through in the military. However, I would be cautious as to what you say regarding childhood trauma because yes, they can use it to reduce you. Also, it may help you if its your first claim for mental health. Any mental trauma prior to the military, CAN be exacerbated by the military itself.
disclosure: I work in medical records at my VA
label: Occupation

title: Can what I say in therapy be used against me?
post: I want to start therapy again and talk about some childhood trauma but I'm worried that if I reveal that that the VA could claim my depression isn't from the military and reduce my rating. comment: I have a long history of childhood trauma. I’ve said this to my vet center therapist, in prolonged exposure therapy and also to my EMDR therapist. I was completely open with my entire trauma history as well as my trauma in the military. I found out that I had complex PTSD before I even joined the army, and my trauma in the military made everything worse. It hasn’t been used against me, and I have been 100% P&T for PTSD since 2017. I’ve been 100% for PTSD since 2010.
disclosure: I have a long history of childhood trauma

title: looking for hotel recommendations in downtown Atlanta needing suggestions
post: Me and my wife have a weekend trip planned in January for the stranger things experience and are needed recommendations for hotels in downtown. Any suggestions appreciated.
comment:
I’ve stayed at the Ritz, Westin, Hyatt, Hilton, and Marriot within the last 24/mo. Other than the Ritz, the Westin is the only lower cost hotel I’d consider staying at again. 

I wouldn’t stay at any of the others again. Terrible, terrible experiences with other hotel guests. The Ritz Carlton is a safe bet that guests that behave poorly won’t be staying there. 

The biggest issue I had at the other downtown hotels were people drunkenly roaming the halls at night screaming obscenities, and hotel security not having the staff to do absolutely anything about it.
disclosure: I’ve stayed at the Ritz, Westin, Hyatt, Hilton, and Marriot

post: Really want to do Biscayne National Park for a snorkeling/camping trip in the next couple of months, since Dry Tortugas is really booked up. For those who have done this, what are your recommendations? Looks like camping is first come/first served. Do they run out of space on the campgrounds? How do you recommend getting to the island?
disclosure: Really want to do Biscayne National Park for a snorkeling/camping trip

title: Biscayne National Park - Logistics?
post: Really want to do Biscayne National Park for a snorkeling/camping trip in the next couple of months, since Dry Tortugas is really booked up. For those who have done this, what are your recommendations? Looks like camping is first come/first served. Do they run out of space on the campgrounds? How do you recommend getting to the island?
comment:
I just went there this September! I didn't camp there, I wasn't even aware that you could since it's a mostly by boat park.

If you go to the NPS website, there's a contact info tab and you can email them directly about camping. Otherwise, you'll have to book a tour to visit unless you have your own boat!

I went paddleboarding near the mangrove and had an awesome time. Just make sure you have some mosquito gear with you and heavy duty spray! 

If you are able and really want to go snorkeling, I'd recommend Looe Key. I went through Captain Hook's in Big Pine Key and it was such an amazing experience and my first time!

title: Spikes out of nowhere??
post:
I’ve been off my medicine for several months now and have been properly managing my diabetes through diet and exercise. My A1c test this month was a 6.4 (down from a 6.5 last month) and overall my sugar readings haven’t been too bad.

Two days ago I started feeling really crappy and checked my sugar to find it 250. It didn’t go down throughout the night or the next morning. Called my Dr. and she had me come in to do labs to make sure everything was fine which it was. 

It finally starting dropping around 4pm but it only got into the 160s before it spiked to the 200s again after eating dinner (this dinner maybe had 9 carbs max). 

I woke up with it at 215 again today and still feel gross. 

Any ideas what might be causing the spikes? I haven’t been eating a bunch of sugar/carbs and I didn’t take a break in my exercise so I’m a little lost!
label: Health

I woke up with it at 215 again today and still feel gross. 

Any ideas what might be causing the spikes? I haven’t been eating a bunch of sugar/carbs and I didn’t take a break in my exercise so I’m a little lost!
comment: Period/ovulation/sick/infection are all the things that makes my blood sugar weird.  I usually get higher blood sugar at my period but this time it went ultra low and my average yesterday was 4.6 was weird.  I find with hormone stuff it goes higher or lower and with sickness/infection it just goes high and doesnt come down for a few extra hours.  So like my 4 hour pp will be  the high end of normal even if I eat minimal carbs.  I had an infection early december and I didnt even feel bad for a few days then it was sinus/uti at the same time and I felt minimal discomfort but it showed in blood work.  Makes you wonder what your blood sugar was like with these things when non diabetic.  Sick people who don't have diabetes also have blood sugar go up idk how much though
label: Gender

title: Should I keep taking the antibiotics?
post:
33F, I started having UTI symptoms (bladder discomfort, frequent urge to urinate, lower back pain) on Christmas and had a virtual appointment with a provider who prescribed me Macrobid (nitrofurantoin). The next day I went to urgent care as the back pain had gotten worse and they did a urinalysis (showed negative) and sent off for a urine culture. 

The culture came back today showing no growth or evidence of a UTI. I’m still feeling symptoms though, particularly bladder irritation and frequent urge to urinate. The doctor basically said it’s up to me if I want to continue taking the macrobid. I’m halfway through the course. Should I finish it?
label: Health

The next day I went to urgent care as the back pain had gotten worse and they did a urinalysis (showed negative) and sent off for a urine culture. 

The culture came back today showing no growth or evidence of a UTI. I’m still feeling symptoms though, particularly bladder irritation and frequent urge to urinate. The doctor basically said it’s up to me if I want to continue taking the macrobid. I’m halfway through the course. Should I finish it?
label: Time

comment: I'm a male who also has the urge to urinate, and I've had it periodically for years. Ibuprofen really helps - I was told I may have interstitial cystitis, but it was a super weak diagnosis. Historically if I take ibuprofen for a few days, the urge to urinate is cured and doesn't come back (at least not for weeks/months). The reason I was given is ibuprofen reduces inflammation, and if your bladder is overactive or inflamed for no reason this would fix it. It can be caused by diet, so if you ate anything unusual recently that would be good to note!

title: Local spots in NYC?
post:
I live in London and I never get it when people come here and only stay around Central London, that's such a small part of the city and to really see the communities that make London so great you have to get further out. I'm sure the same is true for New York? 

I've been quite a few times but not for many years and I'm coming back next month, I've seen the usual spots in Manhattan and I'm wondering what other spots you guys would recommend checking out? I love street food/ cheap restaurants, diverse vibrant communities, nice parks, bars, cinemas etc.
label: Location

For me, Latuda has been a wonderfully effective medication so I’ve decided to keep taking it despite the side effects. title: If I wanna apply for a credit card on a bank, is it better to open a savings account on a branch or is it the same as online?
post: Which of the two has a higher chance of getting approved if ever mag aapply ako ng credit card sa bank. Or the same lang ba?
comment:
In my experience, I got my first CC when I opened a joint account sa BDO. They issued 2 cards for me that time. Pero kung without opening a bank account, I would have been rejected outright kasi I was only making 8 thousand a month back then. Yeah, sucks to be an LGU contractual employee.

And due to my cards from BDO, I was able to easily apply a card from Citibank.
disclosure: I got my first CC when I opened a joint account sa BDO.

post:
Hey everyone, I’m new on here so please ignore if it’s not allowed. My wife and I purchased tickets for the NYE show in Charlotte. Have really been looking forward to it but are both sick with the flu. Wanted to see if anyone here was interested in it.

The package includes show perks and one night in OMNI Charlotte hotel (check in 12/31, check out 1/1/23). This package is for two people. We paid $820 but wanting to sell for $650. Hopefully this can be something that’s a fun last minute show for someone and we can recoup some money spent.

Two General Admission Pit ticket with early entry 

Invitation to an exclusive pre-show party in “The Perfect Space” Lounge with complimentary food and cash bar

Access to “The Perfect Space” Lounge throughout the entire evening

Complimentary coat check
Two limited edition event poster

Two exclusive The Avett Brothers merchandise item

title: Switched Home Insurance due to increase in premium on 12/8 - How long does it take for Escrow Adjustment to Take Place?
post:
Hi all;

Hoping you can help a new home-owner with a situation.

My loan was transferred to a New Bank and when that happened ... An escrow adjustment was made at the end of November, I received a notification from Geico that my Premium increased from 1440 to about 2850!!! (Shitty ass HomeSite Company Geico affiliates with).  I found that the increase was **not** due to property tax - just the insurance company overpricing.

So I left Geico for State Farm first week of Dec.  My new insurance and paperwork was accepted by my Bank on 12/8.  I called the bank **each and every week** asking for the escrow to again be adjusted as I have a 60 day grace period where no late fees would be applied so I wanted to see if I could get my mortgage payment readjusted before I started paying again.

Fast forward to 12/29 and this was still not completed.  So my question is what can I do about this besides tracking the extra money I am paying based on my old insurance and hoping for a refund once they actually do the job I asked them to do back in early December?  I am just wondering if I missed something here in terms of pushing for the escrow as I did request this multiple times.  Unfortunately I paid my Nov and Dec Mortgage, but I am keeping all the information hoping I get refunded back the extra money I am paying.

Any advice would be much appreciated ... Thank you.  I feel I was screwed pretty good here.
disclosure: I received a notification from Geico that my Premium increased from 1440 to about 2850
label: Finance

title: Switched Home Insurance due to increase in premium on 12/8 - How long does it take for Escrow Adjustment to Take Place?
post:
Hi all;

Hoping you can help a new home-owner with a situation.

My loan was transferred to a New Bank and when that happened ... An escrow adjustment was made at the end of November, I received a notification from Geico that my Premium increased from 1440 to about 2850!!! (Shitty ass HomeSite Company Geico affiliates with).  I found that the increase was **not** due to property tax - just the insurance company overpricing.

So I left Geico for State Farm first week of Dec.  My new insurance and paperwork was accepted by my Bank on 12/8.  I called the bank **each and every week** asking for the escrow to again be adjusted as I have a 60 day grace period where no late fees would be applied so I wanted to see if I could get my mortgage payment readjusted before I started paying again.

Fast forward to 12/29 and this was still not completed.  So my question is what can I do about this besides tracking the extra money I am paying based on my old insurance and hoping for a refund once they actually do the job I asked them to do back in early December?  I am just wondering if I missed something here in terms of pushing for the escrow as I did request this multiple times.  Unfortunately I paid my Nov and Dec Mortgage, but I am keeping all the information hoping I get refunded back the extra money I am paying.

Any advice would be much appreciated ... Thank you.  I feel I was screwed pretty good here.
